result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory Dontrelle Matthews

records.addlTxt: NOH (BBH) returned by PO. Return to sender. Attempted - not known. Unable to forward. olg

2:19 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates. Defendant Gregory Dontrelle Matthews appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Gregory Dontrelle Matthews.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Ellenwood reviews case, requests NC remain. Atty Schmidt argument. Court notes victim witness representative present in court. Atty Schmidt advises DE to speak; DE advises court. Court denies request to modify bond. Bond to remain in form and substance. Adjourned: 2:29 p.m.

9:30 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Gregory Dontrelle Matthews appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Gregory Dontrelle Matthews.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Schmidt requests to amend bond to allow contact with victim as it relates to childcare. Parties to confirm status of DEF in MN. Def is approved to appear via zoom. Court is not opposed to amend contact as it relates to children however, requests confirmation re: DANCO. The State to attempt to contact Victim.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
for DE to appear via zoom for BBH on 10/07/22. Filed by Atty Schmidt. arc      Zoom approved by RMW on 10-4-2022. JA will let Atty. Schmidt know. arc
Bail/bond hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
for bond hearing. Filed by Atty. Schmidt. Per RMW - set for hearing. kma

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by PD's office, appointing Atty Schmidt. bph

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K.M.O.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:36 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Gregory Dontrelle Matthews appeared by video, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. NG. Reserve on pre-plea rights. DE does qualify for PD. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets PSC. gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
